posts.title: How to Install OPC Skills in Claude Code (2-Minute Tutorial)
posts.description: Install 9 AI automation skills in Claude Code in 2 minutes. Save $127/month vs paid tools and reduce manual tasks by 85%. Get reddit research (no API key), domain hunting, SEO optimization, and logo creation. Complete guide with troubleshooting and real user success stories.
posts.author: OPC Team

schema.name: How to Install OPC Skills in Claude Code
schema.description: Step-by-step tutorial to install OPC Skills in Claude Code marketplace. Takes 2 minutes.

step.name: Add OPC Skills Marketplace
step.text: Open Claude Code and run: /plugin marketplace add ReScienceLab/opc-skills

step.name: Install Skills
step.text: Run: /plugin install reddit@opc-skills (or any other skill)

faq.question: How long does it take to install OPC Skills in Claude Code?
faq.answer: Installation takes approximately 2 minutes: 30 seconds to add the marketplace, 1 minute to install skills, and 30 seconds to verify. No configuration required for skills without API keys.

faq.question: Do I need Claude Code Pro to use OPC Skills?
faq.answer: No. OPC Skills work with the free version of Claude Code. All 9 skills are compatible with both free and Pro versions.

faq.question: Which skills require API keys?
faq.answer: requesthunt (requires API key), twitter (requires twitterapi.io key), logo-creator/banner-creator/nanobanana (require Gemini API key with free tier), producthunt (requires Product Hunt token). reddit, domain-hunter, and seo-geo work without API keys.

faq.question: Can I install OPC Skills on other AI tools besides Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. Use 'npx skills add ReScienceLab/opc-skills' for universal installation on Cursor, Windsurf, Droid, OpenCode, and 12+ other AI coding tools.

faq.question: How do I update OPC Skills to the latest version?
faq.answer: Run '/plugin marketplace update opc-skills' in Claude Code to fetch the latest skill versions. Updates are non-breaking and preserve your configurations.

faq.question: What if I get 'Marketplace not found' error?
faq.answer: Ensure correct spelling: /plugin marketplace add ReScienceLab/opc-skills (case-sensitive). Check internet connection and verify GitHub is accessible. Wait 1 minute if rate-limited.

faq.question: Are OPC Skills free?
faq.answer: Yes, all 9 skills are open source (MIT license). Some skills integrate with third-party APIs that may require paid keys (e.g., Twitter API), but many work completely free.

faq.question: How much can I save using OPC Skills vs paid automation tools?
faq.answer: Average savings: $127/month. Manual tasks that take 10-15 hours/week are reduced by 85%. Domain hunting saves $15-30 per domain. Logo creation saves $200-500 vs hiring designers.

faq.question: Can I contribute new skills to OPC Skills?
faq.answer: Yes! OPC Skills is open source. Fork the GitHub repository, create your skill following the SKILL.md template, and submit a pull request. See Contributing Guide for details.

faq.question: Which skill should I install first as a beginner?
faq.answer: Start with 'reddit' (no API key required). It's simple, powerful, and demonstrates the core concept of skills. Use it to search Reddit posts and validate product ideas.

schema.headline: How to Build MVPs for Free: DeepSeek + Jan + OPC Skills = $0 API Costs
schema.description: Complete guide to building MVPs with zero API infrastructure costs using free open-source models, local inference, and OPC Skills automation.
schema.keywords: free AI infrastructure, DeepSeek, Jan v3-4B, zero API costs, MVP builder, local LLM, solopreneur

faq.question: Is it really possible to build production MVPs with $0 API costs?
faq.answer: Yes. Jan v3-4B handles 70-80% of MVP development tasks. For the remaining 20%, you can iterate with Jan (slower but free) or pay $20-50 for Claude API. Average MVP: 80% Jan, 20% Claude = $20-50 total cost instead of $200+.

faq.question: What hardware do I need to run Jan locally?
faq.answer: Minimum: 16GB RAM, 40GB storage, any M1+ Mac or recent gaming laptop. Recommended: 32GB+ RAM, SSD. Jan runs ~30 tokens/sec on M3, ~40 tokens/sec on RTX 4070. Slower than Claude API but free and unlimited scaling.

faq.question: How does Jan v3-4B compare to Claude for coding?
faq.answer: Jan handles CRUD, boilerplate, bug fixes, and simple features at 70-85% of Claude's quality. For complex architecture or security-critical code, use Claude. The hybrid approach: use Jan for 70% of features, Claude for critical 20%, iterate with Jan for 10%.

faq.question: What is DeepSeek and why is it free?
faq.answer: DeepSeek is backed by High-Flyer, a quantitative hedge fund with 140-200 people. They release world-class open-source models for free. DeepSeek OCR-2 handles document processing 97% accurately, compared to Claude Vision at 95% for $0.03/image.

faq.question: Can I use Jan + DeepSeek for production services?
faq.answer: Yes. Both are open-source with no licensing restrictions. You can build and sell products using them. No API rate limits. The only cost is your hardware.

faq.question: How long does setup take?
faq.answer: Install Jan (10 min), download v3-4B model (10 min), install OPC Skills (2 min) = 22 minutes total. First MVP ready to build immediately after.

faq.question: What if Jan fails on a complex feature?
faq.answer: Options: (1) Iterate with Jan (free, slow), (2) Use Claude API for that feature only ($0.24-1), (3) Simplify the feature to match Jan's capabilities. Most solopreneurs choose (1) or (2).

faq.question: Is this approach better than using Llama or other free models?
faq.answer: Llama 70B is higher quality but needs 140GB VRAM (most people don't have). Jan v3-4B is optimized for consumer hardware. Llama better if you have GPU; Jan better for local development on laptops.

faq.question: How do I integrate OPC Skills with Jan?
faq.answer: Install OPC Skills globally (npx skills add ReScienceLab/opc-skills), then use them in Claude Code or Cursor with Jan as your model. OPC Skills work with any compatible AI tool + local inference.

faq.question: What's the breakeven point: local infrastructure vs Claude API costs?
faq.answer: If you buy a gaming laptop ($1500) for local development vs Claude API ($200/month), you break even in 7.5 months. After that, all development is free forever. For existing Mac users: breakeven is month 1 (already own hardware).

posts.author: OPC Team

schema.headline: How Solopreneurs Build MVPs Automatically with Ralph: From PRD to Production in 24 Hours
schema.description: Complete tutorial on using Ralph's autonomous AI agent loop to build MVPs. Includes real case study, OPC Skills integration, and step-by-step setup guide.
schema.keywords: Ralph AI, autonomous development, MVP builder, solopreneur tools, PRD automation

faq.question: What is Ralph AI and how does it work?
faq.answer: Ralph is an autonomous AI agent loop that runs coding tools (Amp or Claude Code) repeatedly until all PRD items are complete. Each iteration spawns a fresh AI instance that picks the highest priority incomplete task, implements it, runs tests, and commits. Memory persists via git history, progress.txt, and prd.json.

faq.question: Can solopreneurs build MVPs with Ralph without coding experience?
faq.answer: Yes. Ralph requires a PRD which you can create by describing your idea in plain English. Ralph handles all coding automatically. You need basic command line knowledge but no programming skills required.

faq.question: How long does Ralph take to build an MVP?
faq.answer: Based on our case study, Ralph built a complete SaaS dashboard with authentication in 24 hours (15 user stories, 47 commits, 28 passing tests). Typical MVPs take 24-72 hours of autonomous development.

faq.question: Which AI coding tools does Ralph support?
faq.answer: Ralph natively supports Amp CLI (default) and Claude Code. Use ./ralph.sh for Amp or ./ralph.sh --tool claude for Claude Code.

faq.question: How does Ralph integrate with OPC Skills?
faq.answer: Install OPC skills globally (npx skills add ReScienceLab/opc-skills) and Ralph's AI instances automatically have access during the loop. Your PRD can reference skills like domain-hunter or logo-creator, and Ralph invokes them as needed.

faq.question: What is prd.json and how do I create it?
faq.answer: prd.json is a JSON file containing user stories with pass/fail status. Create it using the ralph skill: (1) Write PRD in markdown, (2) Run 'Load ralph skill and convert prd.md to prd.json'.

faq.question: Does Ralph work for frontend/UI development?
faq.answer: Yes. Include 'Verify in browser using dev-browser skill' in your PRD acceptance criteria. Ralph will navigate to pages, interact with UI, and take screenshots to verify implementation.

faq.question: How much does it cost to run Ralph?
faq.answer: Claude Code (Sonnet 4.5): $30-60 for typical MVP. Amp pricing varies. Ralph is often cheaper than manual coding because fresh context reduces retries and errors.

faq.question: Is Ralph production-ready for startups?
faq.answer: Yes, with caveats. Ralph requires strong feedback loops (tests, type checking) and well-structured PRDs. Best for solopreneurs who can review code before deployment. 7.9k GitHub stars indicate active community usage.

faq.question: What are the prerequisites to run Ralph?
faq.answer: You need: (1) Amp CLI or Claude Code installed, (2) jq command (brew install jq), (3) Git repository, (4) Basic understanding of your tech stack to write meaningful PRD items.

faq.question: How do I convert documentation to an agent skill?
faq.answer: Follow the 5-step process: (1) Extract actionable content, (2) Rewrite as imperative instructions, (3) Add YAML frontmatter, (4) Add example workflows, (5) Test with Claude Code. Takes about 5 minutes.

faq.question: What is the Skill.md format?
faq.answer: Skill.md is a markdown file with YAML frontmatter containing name, description, triggers, and dependencies. The body contains structured instructions and examples that AI can execute.

faq.question: Which AI platforms support skills?
faq.answer: As of January 2026, 6 major platforms natively support skills: Claude Code, Cursor, Windsurf, OpenCode, Codex (via adapters), and Droid (Factory).

faq.question: How long does it take to create a skill?
faq.answer: A basic skill takes 5 minutes from existing documentation. Complex skills with scripts may take 15-30 minutes. No coding required for markdown-only skills.
